Text: can't wait to check this out. I love reading these golden age/silver age classics now that I'm older and wiser. The stories are far more clever than when I used to look at them when I was young and ignorant.

ditko and skeates did some truly innovative work on this title. of course no one bought it... to create this concept during the vietnam war was timely and unique, to say the least.

i always found it interesting that dc chose to kill off don but not hank, and then that the kesels (under mike carlin's watch) decided to make the new dove a woman. i think it weakens the concept and allowed the readers to think that a pacifistic hero "had to be" a woman.

my favorite hawk & dove story of the last 20 years was the one-panel phrase "don hall of earth, at peace" when a black lantern ring tried to resurrect him.

mike baron's mediocre revamp attempt and the new 52 reboot were awful.
Thank you STFmaryville. This seems very interesting/
Cool. And now I completed my Hawk and Dove collection for good! Thanks!

you're all welcome. you can read the rest of hawk & dove's silver age adventures in blackcanary's awesome torrent  http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/7937414/ . they joined up in 1969's issue 21 and appeared sporadically, notably in #25-29 and as part of the short-lived "titans west" team in #50-52.
